The contact information provided below is for some of the University's more critical offices.         If you are looking for a specific person or specific information at New York University, you can search for them in our online directories, or call the number listed to the right.     Student Information   University Development and Alumni Relations   University Relations and Public Affairs                      Student Information   The offices below cover a wide range of needs for prospective, incoming, and current students. If you're looking for information regarding taking a tour of NYU, financial aid, registration for classes, and paying your bill, the offices below can guide you.        Undergraduate Admissions   For information sessions and campus tours:   Jeffrey S. Gould Welcome Center  50 West Fourth Street  New York, NY 10003  212.998.4550  Weekdays: 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM  Saturday: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM   For questions about admissions and to mail application materials:   665 Broadway, 11th Floor  New York, NY 10012  212.998.4500   admissions.ops@nyu.edu          Office of Financial Aid   25 West Fourth Street, 1st Floor  New York, NY 10012  212.998.4444  212.995.4661 (Fax)   financial.aid@nyu.edu   Office of the Registrar   25 West Fourth Street, 1st Floor  New York, NY 10012  212.998.4800 (University Registrar General Number)     Office of the Bursar   25 West Fourth Street, 1st Floor  New York, NY 10012  212.998.2800          The Student Resource Center   60 Washington Square South, Suite 210  New York, NY 10012  212.998.4411  Contact via email: Ask Us a Question        Student Health Center   726 Broadway, 3rd and 4th Floors  New York, NY 10003  212.443.1000   health.center@nyu.edu            University Development and Alumni Relations   NYU’s office of University Development and Alumni Relations (UDAR) focuses on the engagement of the entire NYU community – trustees, deans, students, faculty members, administration and staff, alumni, parents, and friends. If you have questions regarding alumni benefits or giving to the University, please contact UDAR and they can guide you.   UDAR Office   25 West Fourth Street, 4th Floor  New York, NY 10012  212.998.6900            University Relations and Public Affairs   University Relations and Public Affairs is responsible for ensuring that NYU’s message, agenda, and image are effectively and creatively projected to both external and internal audiences. If you have questions regarding NYU and its local community, photo or film shoots, or using the University's brand or identity, contact the offices below and someone will guide you in the right direction.   Office of Public Affairs   25 West Fourth Street, 5th Floor  New York, NY 10012  212.998.6840   Office of Government and Community Affairs   25 West Fourth Street, 5th Floor  New York, NY 10012  212.998.2400                                          New York University        70 Washington Square South          New York, NY 10012                      212.998.1212              Department of Public Safety   14 Washington Place, 1st Floor  New York, NY 10003  212.998.2222        NYU Parent's Helpline   212.998.4219  Contact via email: Ask Us a Question        Office of Residential Life and Housing Services   726 Broadway, 7th Floor  New York, NY 10003  212.998.4600   housing@nyu.edu        Bobst Library Information   70 Washington Square South  New York, NY 10012  212.998.2500   Coles Sports Center   181 Mercer Street  New York, NY 10012  212.998.2020   Palladium Athletic Facility   140 East 14th Street  New York, NY 10003  212.992.8500   Skirball Center for the Performing Arts,  Shagan Box Office   566 La Guardia Place  New York, NY 10012  212.992.8484   Main Bookstore   726 Broadway  New York, NY 10003  212.998.4667   NYU Computer Store   726 Broadway (inside Main Bookstore)  New York, NY 10003  212.998.4672   Copy Central   547 La Guardia Place  New York, NY 10012  212.998.1050   Mail Services   547 La Guardia Place  New York, NY 10012  212.998.1010   Student Affairs   60 Washington Square South, Suite 601  New York, NY 10012  212.998.4410   Student Activities   60 Washington Square South, Suite 704C  New York, NY 10012  212.998.4700                                              NYU Footer          Search      Directory      Campus Map      Events      Contact Us      Site Map      Copyright and Fair Use      Feedback         Unless otherwise noted, all content copyright New York University. West 10th, CWP | NYU                         NEW YORK UNIVERSITY       ARTS AND SCIENCE       COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SCIENCE       GRADUATE SCHOOL OF ARTS AND SCIENCE                           Creative Writing Program                                                                                                Back to  previous page                Printer Friendly       West 10th, A Student-Edited Literary Journal for NYU Undergraduates            West 10th is a literary   journal publishing poetry, prose, and photography by New York University's undergraduate students. It is edited and produced annually by a student-run editorial board and by the NYU Creative Writing Program.     Find out more about West 10th :      The site: http://west10th.org/ The Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/West10th Twitter: http://twitter.com/West10thLit 2014-2015 Editorial Board    Editor in Chief : Eric Steifel Managing Editor : Michelle Ling Poetry Editors : Rebecca Pecaut, Sasha Leshnerr Assistant Poetry Editors : Colin Drohan, Brittany Siler Prose Editor : Anzhe Zhang Assistant Prose Editor : Alyssa Matesic Art Editor : Chuck Kuan Copy Editor : Olivia Loving          Congratulations to the 2013-14 Contributors!                      POETRY       PROSE       ART       GUEST CONTRIBUTORS       Jade Conlee Sasha Leshner Amy Moore Danielle M. Rico Andy Sebela Jenna Snyder Madeleine Walker    Zeba Fazli Neda Jebelli Emma Wren Anzhe Zhang      Jennifer Coates   Neha Hirve Dakota Richardson Virgina Tadini Haley Weiss     Poetry by Matthew Dickman and an interview with Tao Lin      West 10th Editors' Awards in Prose & Poetry To celebrate the publication of West 10th , the NYU Creative Writing Program sponsors the West 10th Editors’ Awards each spring. Program faculty serving as Executive Editors select one poem and one prose piece from the student contributions to be featured in the upcoming issue of the journal. Award recipients each receive a prize of $200 and are invited to read their work at the West 10th launch party. The 2013-2014 Editors' Award Winner in Prose is Emma Wren for her story "Murder at the Turtle Pageant." The 2013-2014 Editors' Award Winner in Poetry is Jade Conlee for her poem "Fluxx."
